intro: Juanulloa mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican jicara, is a shrub native to southern Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it is often found in dry, rocky soils. The plant has been used traditionally for its medicinal properties and as a source of fiber.
